Print Summary of a Linear Model Fit

print.info.lm.Rd

print method for class "info.lm".

# S3 method for info.lm
print(x, digits = 3, ...)

Arguments

x

an object of class "info.lm" produced by the "info.lm" function.

digits

number of significant digits to print.

...

parameters passed to print.

Examples

fit <- lm(mpg ~ wt + hp + disp, data=mtcars)
sfit <- info(fit)
print(sfit, digits=5)
#> MULTIPLE REGRESSION SUMMARY 
#> Model: mpg ~ wt + hp + disp
#> Data : mtcars
#> N    : 32
#> 
#> Fit Indices 
#>  R.Squared Adj.R.Squared    AIC   RMSE   MAE
#>    0.82684       0.80828 158.64 2.4685 1.907
#> 
#> Omnibus Test 
#> F(3,28) = 44.56552, p < 8.6496e-11  *** 
#> 
#> Anova Table (type III tests) 
#>                 Sum Sq DF   F value   Pr(>F)    
#> (Intercept) 2151.94945  1 309.01265 <0.00001 ***
#> wt            88.50276  1   12.7087  0.00133  **
#> hp            51.69183  1   7.42277  0.01097   *
#> disp           0.05708  1    0.0082  0.92851    
#> Residuals    194.99067 28                       
#> 
#> Regression Coefficients 
#>                       B        B*       SE         t   Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept) 37.10550527  0.000000 2.110815 17.578756 1.1619e-16 ***
#> wt          -3.80089058 -0.617064 1.066191 -3.564926 1.3310e-03  **
#> hp          -0.03115655 -0.354439 0.011436 -2.724476 1.0971e-02   *
#> disp        -0.00093701 -0.019269 0.010350 -0.090535 9.2851e-01
